captions.text:
fast falls the eventide;
the darkness deepens.

(SPEAKING) No, this is not
what I told you to get me.

I've got to put this up in 15
minutes, and I've got nothing.

You can't do anything
about it now.

You were supposed to
take care of this.

OK, well, there's also been
a bombing at a university.

(SINGING) When other
helpers fail and comforts

flee, help of the helpless,
oh, abide with me!

Thru cloud and sunshine,
Lord, abide with me!

title: Abide With Me - Finding Peace Through Prayer

comments.author: Diane Collard

comments.text:
"Oh Savior, stay this night with me. Behold, tis even tide." (Hymn # 165) 
During the turmoil of depression and anxiety I retired to bed one night. I 
sang this song through my tears. I know the Savior knew what I was feeling 
and going through. He knows what you're going through too. In our darkest 
moments, we can cry unto a Savior and He will surround us in His loving 
arms and we are never alone. Never forget that you can pray. Prayer keeps 
me going. God hears and answers prayers. He knows you individually and 
cares about what you are going through. He never leaves, He is always 
there.Seek Him as you search out your heart and as you see what He desires 
of you. He desires that you come unto Him and learn of Him. The Savior 
said, "Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will 
give you rest.Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and 
lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls. For my yoke is 
easy, and my burden is light." He loves YOU! He wants you to be happy. He 
can show you how. The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints teaches 
me of God and brings me closer to Christ. Check out this church, it is 
wonderful! :) I know it is true. I am so happy! I know the Savior lives. 
This is my testimony, In the name of Jesus Christ, Amen. ﻿

comments.text:
A saint shrinks not from troubling and challenging times. These are the 
Lord's lessons unfolded in out path to teach eternal principles. Most see 
them as disruptive of life, but they are life, the most instructive and 
important moments of eternal significance here in this temporal laboratory, 
this university of life. ﻿
comments.author: Frankincensed

comments.text:
I remember in my mission, my companion and i tried everything we could do 
to help a brother come back to church. we read, we prayed, we fasted, we 
taught everything, we became his friend, until one day we felt we needed to 
sing to him "how great thou art". He came back to church that following 
sunday. Music especially hymns have a power we can't imagine, they impact 
directly into the human soul. ﻿

that is good she understands that she made someone feel bad. it is still

comments.author: Atelaite Vea

comments.text:
My initial thought was what an impatient supervisor this guy had; without 
thinking she might have been dealing with some of her own issues. Then it 
occurred to me that she, after seeing her coworker was a former student of 
the college that was attacked in the video just made that same realization 
that I made about her character...then as has often times happens to me 
when I've lashed out, she felt chastened and sorry for being so 
insensitive. Brings to mind a scripture a close friend of mine told me 
about: D&C98: 40 "...and as oft as thine enemy repenteth of the trespass 
wherewith he has trespassed against thee, thou shalt forgive him, until 
seventy times seven." I'd like to think the man in the video forgave her 
for her insensitivity. ﻿
comments.author: Mark M

comments.text:
I've been going though some extreme anxiety lately like in the past couple 
of weeks.  My job cut back my hours drastically and money is very tight.  
I've been worrying about becoming homeless.  Not only have I been worrying 
about myself...but everyone around me.  My mind has been on an amazing 
race.  Insomnia and no eating hardly.  Point is...I can so relate to this 
video so much!!!  I am that lady per say.﻿

comments.text:
Beautifully done i'm a retired news director from CNN headline news, this 
rings very true! Although I hope I didn't treat any interns this badly﻿
comments.author: Sheila Hunter

comments.text: Radio:) I just love Mormon Messages!
comments.author: Sheila Hunter

comments.text:
Absolutely beautifully done! I'm a retired News director, and I used to 
work for CNN headline news radio. this rings very true to me! Although I 
hope I didn't treat any interns that meanly LOL it makes you stop and 
think, we all live in a separate reality. Sometimes we're assuming things 
about other people without knowing full story. At first it just seem like 
this intern was a slacker. Then reality he was grappling with the fact that 
it could've been his friends that were killed his university. I remember 
starting at CNN during the Gulf War and how stressful that was! But I love 
about LDS church productions and I'm in LDS convert from Jewish background. 
Is that they are very professionally done, and extremely relatable. Thank 
you again!!﻿
comments.author: kittywaymo

to your Heavenly Father. Prayer is a way where we can abide with him. ﻿
